org.gphoto2

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gphoto2.Camera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class Camera
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Represents a camera. Thread-unsafe.
    Author:
    Martin Vysny

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Camera()
      Creates a reference to the first connected camera.

        public void deinitialize()
                  throws IOException

        Throws:

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        De-initializes the camera and frees all resources. Further invocations to this method do nothing. Any camera method will fail from now on with IllegalStateException.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IOException

      • capturePreview

        public CameraFile capturePreview()
        Captures a quick preview image on the camera.
        Returns:
        camera file, never null. Must be closed afterwards.

      • newConfiguration

        public CameraWidgets newConfiguration()
        Returns new configuration for the camera.
        Returns:
        the configuration, never null. Must be closed afterwards.

      • captureImage

        public CameraFile captureImage()
        Captures a full-quality image image on the camera.
        Returns:
        camera file, never null. Must be closed afterwards.

      • getLibraryVersion

        public static String getLibraryVersion()
        Returns library versions as a displayable string.
        Returns:
        verbose version, never null, for example: "2.4.10.1 gcc (C compiler used) ltdl (for portable loading of camlibs) EXIF (for special handling of EXIF files) "

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
